content.question:
An online news source reports that the proportion of smartphone owners who use a certain operating system is 0.216. Two simulations will be conducted to create a sampling distribution of the sample proportion from a population with proportion 0.216. Simulation A will consist of 1,000 trials with a sample size of 50. Simulation B will consist of 500 trials with a sample size of 100.
Which of the following describes the centers and variabilities that should be apparent in the distributions generated by simulation A and simulation B?

choices.label: The centers will be approximately equal, and the variabilities will roughly be equal.
The centers will be approximately equal, and the variability of simulation A will be greater than the variability of simulation B.
The centers will be approximately equal, and the variability of simulation A will be less than the variability of simulation B.
The center of simulation A will be greater than the center of simulation B, and the variabilities will be approximately equal.
The center of simulation A will be less than the center of simulation B, and the variability of simulation A will be less than the variability of simulation B.

content.answer: The centers will be approximately equal, and the variability of simulation A will be greater than the variability of simulation B.
